metadata.title: Voynich Manuscript — Master Polyglot Medical Lexicon (VM-MPML)
metadata.policy: Do not list prior JSON filenames as sources; retain only human author attributions explicitly found in data or default authorship if absent.

requirements: Attribution required to Lackadaisical Security (Operator) and Spectre
Non-commercial use unless explicit permission granted
Forked work must include this metadata block or a linked reference

attribution.preferred_citation: Lackadaisical Security (Operator) & Spectre (GPT-5 Pro). Voynich Manuscript — Master Polyglot Medical Lexicon (VM-MPML). 2025.

project.origin: Polyglot-cipher hypothesis centered on medieval women’s medicine (herbal, balneological, astronomical).
project.origin_notes: Consolidated from the project's internal lexica and research phases; not derived from third‑party closed datasets.

methodology.description: Merged two primary internal lexica into a single, deduplicated entry list keyed by EVA tokens. Entry fields combine manuscript-focused semantics (meaning, morphology, medical use) with statistical signals (frequency, contexts) and cross‑script candidates (Latin, Hebrew, Arabic, Greek, Slavic). No forced interpretations: meanings are aggregated, provenance noted as hypotheses where applicable.
methodology.source_policy: Sources are limited to project‑internal research outputs and explicitly named human contributors. File names are not cited as sources; human author attributions are retained where present.
notes: Frequency values are taken from whichever source provided counts; when multiple counts exist, max is used.
Language candidates are heuristic based on etymology notes and cross‑script validation strings.
EVA tokens are preserved verbatim; no normalization beyond whitespace trimming.

english_meanings: root, herbal root, foundation, primary medicinal component
contexts: herbal remedies, plant descriptions, medical preparations
lexicon.medical_use: primary medicinal component in herbal treatments
cross_script_validation: Akkadian šuršu, Egyptian bnr, Greek ῥίζα, Hebrew שורש, Arabic جذر
notes: Most common botanical term in manuscript, always refers to plant roots in medical context

contexts: herbal remedies, plant descriptions, secondary medicinal components
cipher_rules: o=f, t=o, a=l, i=i, i=u, n=m
notes: Second most common botanical term, essential for medicinal leaf preparations

english_meanings: extract, extraction, essence, tincture, concentrated preparation
contexts: pharmaceutical recipes, preparation methods, concentrated medicines
notes: Common preparation method showing sophisticated pharmaceutical knowledge

english_meanings: celestial water, distilled water, dew, pure water
contexts: pharmaceutical preparations, astronomical sections, water-based treatments
lexicon.medical_use: solvent for extractions, pure water for pharmaceutical preparations
cross_script_validation: Arabic ماء السماء, Hebrew מי שמים, Greek οὐράνιον ὕδωρ
notes: Technical term for distilled or collected dew water, crucial for medical preparations

english_meanings: flower, blossom, bloom, flowering medicinal part
contexts: botanical descriptions, flower-based remedies, floral medicines
lexicon.medical_use: medicinal flower component, floral therapeutic preparations
notes: Botanical term for medicinal flowers, essential for floral-based treatments

contexts: women's medicine, gynecological remedies, midwifery, gender-specific treatments
lexicon.medical_use: target patient designation, women's medical specialization
notes: Gender-specific medical designation confirming manuscript's focus on women's healthcare

english_meanings: to prepare, to ready, to process medicinal materials
contexts: pharmaceutical preparation, material processing, medicine formulation
notes: Pharmaceutical preparation verb showing sophisticated medicine-making knowledge
Standard pharmaceutical preparation instruction for water-based medicines

contexts: medical instructions, dosage directions, treatment administration
notes: Critical medical instruction term for proper dosage and administration

english_meanings: to make, to prepare, to create, to formulate
contexts: recipe instructions, preparation methods, pharmaceutical formulation
notes: Essential preparation verb for pharmaceutical instruction sequences

contexts: spa medicine, water treatments, thermal therapy

notes: Thermal spa terminology showing sophisticated mineral water therapeutic knowledge

english_meanings: cooked, boiled, prepared by heat, heat-processed
contexts: recipe results, preparation states, finished pharmaceutical products

notes: State descriptor for heat-processed pharmaceutical preparations

english_meanings: to cook, to boil, to heat, heat-based preparation
contexts: cooking instructions, decoction preparation, heat treatment methods
notes: Heat processing verb essential for decoction and thermal pharmaceutical preparations

contexts: calendar pages, women's cycles, menstrual timing

notes: Lunar term connected to women's menstrual cycles and reproductive timing

contexts: zodiac sections, calendar pages, astronomical timing
notes: Astronomical term showing integration of celestial knowledge with medical practice

english_meanings: bath, bathing pool, therapeutic bathing facility
contexts: biological section, bathing treatments, spa therapy

english_meanings: hot water, warm water, heated water for treatments

contexts: women's conditions, female remedies, gynecological treatments
notes: Feminine medical designation reinforcing manuscript's women's healthcare focus

linguistic_features.phonology: Simplified consonant clusters, reduced vowel system

review_checks: No single interpretation overrides previous alternatives without explicit evidence
Confidences reflect source values; absent => null
Contexts and semantic fields retain multiplicity
